lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
Welcome to Duke, your friendly chatbot!
Duke helps you manage your task in a convenient and simple way!
### Feature - find tasks by searching for a keyword `find`
Expected outcome: Prints goodbye message and closes application
List out all the tasks that you currently have
An index of tasks and their indexes.
First letter represents what type of task: E - Event, D - deadline, T- Todo
To get index of task, use the list command above
Expected outcome: Prints out the task that you have marked.
The [X] represents that the task is completed
Unmark a task as completed (mark it as uncompleted)
To get index of task, use the list command above.
Expected outcome: The task that you have unmarked.
To get index of task, use the list command above
Expected outcome: Prints out deleted task.
Add a task that is of type deadline
Add a task deadline called submit documents that is due 12 December 2022 6pm
Expected outcome: Prints out deadline that you have just added
The [D] represents that it is of type deadline.
The [ ] represents that the task has not been completed.
Add a task that is of type event
Add an event holiday that is from 12 December 2022 6pm to 14 December 2022 6pm
Expected outcome: Prints out event that you have just added
The [E] represents that it is of type event.
The [ ] represents that the task has not been completed.
Add a task that is of type todo
Expected Outcome: Prints out todo that you have just added
The [T] represents that it is of type todo.
The [ ] represents that the task has not been completed.
Find tasks by searching for a keyword
Find all tasks that has sweep in their name.
Expected outcome: Prints out tasks that matches keyword
View deadline and event tasks whose beginning or ending date falls on that day
i) Deadline whose deadline falls on 12 December 2022 6pm
ii) Event tasks which begin or end on 12 December 2022 6pm
